definition: to take in/to absorb/to assimilate/to act for/to take a photo/photo shoot/photo/to conserve (one's health)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A wilderness, remote non-life, in the eyes of photographers is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 一片荒野，渺无生机，在摄影家的眼里是美的。

sentences.english: Masao Yamamoto is one of the most internationally influential Japanese photographers.
sentences.chinese: 山本昌男是具有国际影响的日本摄影家之一。

sentences.english: These visual impacts have become a favorite among artists and photographers.
sentences.chinese: 这些视觉影像已经成为艺术家和摄影家们的最爱。

sentences.english: There are two other reasons why prime lenses are the available-light photographers' friends.
sentences.chinese: 此外摄影家钟爱定焦镜头还有另外两个原因。

sentences.english: He is wildlife photographer Hank Tseng (Tseng Chiu-wen), who currently lives in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 他就是旅居加拿大的生态摄影家曾秋文。

sentences.english: Daido Moriyama is one of Japan's most celebrated photographers.
sentences.chinese: 森山大道是日本最著名的摄影家。

sentences.english: Photographers travel around just for input, to draw a circle in their souls.
sentences.chinese: 摄影家走南闯北是为了输入，在自己的心灵画个圆。

sentences.english: Many photographers indeed have released their shutters in front of Ohno.
sentences.chinese: 在大野一雄的面前，有无数的摄影家为他按下了快门。

sentences.english: And he is the member of Shanxi Photographers' Association.
sentences.chinese: 现为山西省摄影家协会会员。

sentences.english: Japanese Photography in Focus small Kubo good guitar has its own unique way.
sentences.chinese: 日本摄影家小久保善吉在调焦方面有自己独特的办法。

definition: to collect local cultural material (recording folk songs, taking photos etc)
to take a photograph/photography/to shoot (a movie)
to sketch from nature/to do a still life drawing
